news.title: OTP not coming problem
news.description: Users encountering difficulties with receiving the OTP on the Sahara India Refund Portal while entering their Aadhaar number might be due to technical glitches on the recently launched website. To resolve this issue, it is recommended to be patient and attempt the process again later. The developers are likely working to fix the problem, and with time, users should be able to receive the OTP and complete their registration on the portal smoothly.

news.title: Why OTP Not Received On Registered Mobile Number
news.description:
There could be several reasons why an OTP (One-Time Password) is not received on the registered mobile number during the registration process on the Sahara Refund Portal. Some common reasons include:  

1. Network Issues: There might be temporary network issues that could prevent the delivery of the OTP to your mobile number. 

2. Incorrect Mobile Number: Double-check that you have entered the correct 10-digit Aadhaar-linked mobile number during registration. 

3. Mobile Network Restrictions: Some mobile network providers may have restrictions or filters that block certain OTP messages. 

4. Delay in Delivery: In some cases, there might be a delay in receiving the OTP due to network congestion or other technical reasons. 

5. Full Inbox: If your mobile inbox is full, the OTP message may not be delivered. Clear some space and try again. 

6. Spam/Blocked Messages: Check if the OTP message has been mistakenly sent to the spam folder or if your mobile provider has blocked the messages. 


If you encounter any issues with receiving the OTP, itтАЩs advisable to wait for a few minutes and try again. If the problem persists, you may contact the support or helpline provided by the Sahara Refund Portal for assistance.

news.description:
Sahara Refund Portal Good news for the investors of Sahara India, in fact, recently the Central Government i.e. Home Minister Amit Shah has launched a portal to withdraw the money deposited in Sahara India. Whose name is - Sahara Refund Portal Let us tell you that through Sahara India Refund Portal, now those people whose money is stuck in Sahara will be able to get their money back online. If you want to get back the money stuck in Sahara India, then you can fill the Sebi Sahara Refund Online Application Form using the link given below. 

 Let us tell you that after registering on Sahara Refund Portal, your deposited money will be credited to your account within 15 to 45 days.

news.title: When the Sahara investors will get the refund?
news.description: Shah stated that the claimants' bank accounts will get the money within 45 days. Once investors submit the application, Sahara group committee will verify the details within 30 days. In the next 15 days, or within 45 days of application, investors will be informed through SMS or website. The refund of claimed amount will be directly credited to DepositorтАЩs Aadhaar seeded bank account only after 45 days from the date of successful claim submission.

news.description: Sahara India Refund Portal Link (mocrefund.crcs.gov.in), Online Claim Process, Documents Required (July 2023): The Union Government has launched CRCS-Sahara Refund Portal today. The portal was launched by Union Home Minister and Minister of Cooperation Amit Shah in Delhi. The portal will help crores of depositors of Sahara Group claim their money back. тАЬThe process of returning the money of depositors, which was stuck in four cooperative societies of Sahara Group, has started with the launch of Sahara Refund Portal,тАЭ Union Minister Amit Shah said while launching the refund portal. Earlier in a statement dated July 17, the Ministry of Cooperation said, тАЬTo address the grievances of genuine members/depositors of Sahara Group of Cooperative Societies for payment of their legitimate deposits, the Ministry of Cooperation had filed an application in the HonтАЩble Supreme Court of India. The HonтАЩble Supreme Court vide its order dated 29th March, 2023 had directed that Rs. 5000 Crores be transferred out of the тАШSahara-SEBI Refund AccountтАЩ, to the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies (CRCS) for disbursement against the legitimate dues of the genuine depositors of the Sahara Group of Cooperative Societies. A Portal has been developed for submission of legitimate claims by the genuine depositors of the Sahara Group of Cooperative Societies namely- Sahara Credit Cooperative Society Ltd., Saharayan Universal Multipurpose Society Ltd., Humara India Credit Cooperative Society Ltd. and Stars Multipurpose Cooperative Society Ltd,тАЭ it added

news.title: Depositor will get refund in 45 days
news.description: Terming this a historic moment, he said this is the first time when depositors are getting refunds in a case where multiple government agencies are involved and each one has done a seizure. Shah assured the depositors that no one can stop their money now and that they will get the refund in 45 days after registering on the portal. The Modi government has started the process of returning the money of the investors stuck in the four co-operative societies of Sahara. This will bring back the credibility of the people towards cooperatives, Shah tweeted.

details.title: рд╣реЛрдо рдкреЗрдЬ
details.description: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has announced to provide free smart phones and free internet for 3 years to all the female heads of 1 crore 35 lakh Chiranjeevi families of Rajasthan. Let us tell you that at present the first phase of the scheme is going on, under which 40 lakh women are being given smart phones of their choice. In this article, we have explained step by step the online process to check eligibility of Indira Gandhi Smartphone Scheme.

details.title: рдкрд╛рддреНрд░рддрд╛ рдХреА рдЬрд╛рдВрдЪ рдХрд░реЗрдВ
details.description:
You can check whether you will get a smart phone in the first phase of free smart phone distribution camp or not by visiting the official website in the following way by clicking on the 'Open Website' button given below. 

1. To check eligibility, first open the website of Indira Gandhi Smartphone Scheme igsy.rajasthan.gov.in by clicking on the 'Open Website' button given below. 

2. On the home page itself you will see the option to check IGSY eligibility 

3. In the next page you have to select your Aadhaar number and scheme category 

4. In the category option, select the scheme of which you are the beneficiary and click on the submit button. 

5. The name of the beneficiary will appear in the next page, which has to be ticked and submitted.6. After doing this, you will get the message if you are eligible.

details.description:
Process to view Indira Gandhi Smartphone Scheme Camp Calendar 2023 

тЧ╛ First of all you have to go to the official IGSY Portal Rajasthan website of Indira Gandhi Free Smart Phone Scheme. 

тЧ╛ After this the home page will open on your screen. 

тЧ╛ On the home page you have to click on the option of Indira Gandhi Smartphone Yojana Camp Calendar. 

тЧ╛ After this a new page will open on your screen. 

тЧ╛ On this page you will have to enter the asked information. 

тЧ╛ The related information will open on your screen. 


 Objective of Indira Gandhi Smartphone Yojana Camp Calendar 2023 

тЧ╛ The main objective of Indira Gandhi Smartphone Yojana Camp Calendar 2023 is to provide the facility to the citizens to apply under the scheme. 

тЧ╛ Through these camps, citizens will be able to apply offline under Indira Gandhi Smartphone Scheme. 

тЧ╛ Now citizens will not need to go to any government office to make this application. 

тЧ╛ They will be able to go to these camps and apply. 

тЧ╛ This process will save both time and money and transparency can also be ensured in the system 


Some important information related to Indira Gandhi Smartphone Yojana Camp 

тЧ╛ The government will decide the number of all the beneficiaries and the number of camps to be organized by 31 July. 

тЧ╛ Other arrangements to be made in the camps and arrangements for tables, chairs, laptops, printers, scanners, fans, coolers, stationery etc. will be completed by August 5.

тЧ╛ The District Collector will provide work to more than one vendor for other materials and services as per requirement and considering the capacity of the available local vendors. 

тЧ╛ District level control rooms will also be established for the successful operation of these camps. 

тЧ╛ All information related to these control rooms and the name, designation and telephone number of the officer in charge will be ensured.

тЧ╛ The official website has also been prepared by the government for the successful implementation of this scheme. 

тЧ╛ Information related to this website will also be provided to the citizens through camps. 

тЧ╛ All preparations related to the camps will be completed by 6 August 2023.

тЧ╛ Live models will be conducted at each camp on 7th, 8th and 9th August. In which smartphones will be provided to 10 beneficiaries. 

тЧ╛ PPO number of pension of women receiving single and widow pension will be obtained. 

тЧ╛ If the age of the beneficiary is less than 18 years, then in this situation the head of the family will have to be brought to buy the SIM. 

тЧ╛ If any beneficiary does not get the benefit in the concerned block camp site on time, then he can avail the benefit of this scheme by going to the camp organized by the district headquarters. 

тЧ╛ Beneficiaries can check their eligibility through the Jan Soochana Portal.

details.description:
During the camp, SIM cards will be distributed according to the layout prepared in Connectivity from Zone 1 to Zone 6 as follows:

a. Zone - 1
тАв The Help Desk team will verify the beneficiary's Aadhaar card, registered mobile number in Aadhaar, Aadhaar card, photo, and other valid documents for e-KYC.
тАв The beneficiary should download the Jan Aadhaar e-Wallet app on their phone and provide other information.

b. Registration Zone - 2
тАв Through IGSY Application, DoIT&C officials present at the Help Desk in Zone 2 will identify the eligibility of the beneficiary and provide Jan Aadhaar e-wallet KYC form, TSP form, and Form-60.

c. SIM Zone - 3
тАв It is for various Telecom Service Providers, where the beneficiary will choose their preferred SIM and internet data plan after e-KYC.
тАв For e-KYC, beneficiaries aged 18 and above will use their own Aadhaar card, and for beneficiaries below 18, they will come with the head of the immortal family and ensure that the head of the immortal family brings their own Aadhaar card.
тАв At least 2 desks and 5 chairs should be provided for each TSP.

d. Mobile Zone - 4
тАв Authorized mobile dealers in the beneficiary can purchase their preferred mobile phone. The beneficiary is free to buy any phone from any dealer.
тАв Along with the authorized mobile dealer, at least 6 desks (tables) and 15 chairs should be made available to collect the mobile details of the beneficiary for the state government employees.

e. DBT Zone - 5
тАв The process carried out by DoIT&C officials
тАв Perform e-Wallet KYC of the beneficiary. After the beneficiary chooses their SIM and internet data plan, their e-KYC will be done. After e-KYC, the new mobile number of the beneficiary will be entered in the IGSY Application on the laptop by the government employee.
тАв The information of the selected mobile and SIM by the beneficiary will be entered in the IGSY Application.
тАв Make DBT to the beneficiary through e-Wallet.
тАв DoIT&C officials will compile all the documents of the beneficiaries and submit them to the district administration every day after the camp ends.
тАв Payment for mobile and data SIM will be made through e-Wallet

f. Digital Handholding Area Zone тАУ 6
тАв For the beneficiaries, the following digital activities questionnaire and street play will be organized for digital literacy:
тАв Interact with the beneficiaries and have them download the applications of the state government in their mobile:
   - Jan Aadhaar Wallet 2-0
   - Jan Aadhaar App
   - E&Mitra App
   - Raj Sampark App
   - Jan Soochna App
тАв Provide information about the state government's public welfare schemes through street plays.
тАв Tokens will be given as prizes for encouragement.
тАв Distribute the 'Digital Sakhi Booklet' for digital literacy to the beneficiaries.
тАв This work will be done through Rajiv Gandhi Youth Friend, Start-Up, and DoIT&C representative.

The above camp zone plan is indicative and the interlinking of zones can be done at the local level according to the available space and arrangement.

details.description:
Question: How can I view the list of beneficiaries for the Indira Gandhi Smartphone Scheme?
Answer: To view the list, you need to first visit the official website. There you will find the option to view the list of beneficiaries. This allows you to see the list for the Indira Gandhi Smartphone Scheme. For more information, you can read the full article.

Question: When will the distribution of free mobile phones begin?
Answer: It will start from August 10, 2023.

Question: How much money will be given for the internet in the Free Mobile Phone Scheme?
Answer: For the financial year 2023-24, Rs. 675 will be given, and thereafter, Rs. 900 per year will be provided.

Question: Is the guarantee card mandatory for the Indira Gandhi Free Smartphone?
Answer: Yes, it is mandatory for 1 crore women in the second phase.

Question: How can I view the second list of Indira Gandhi Free Smartphone?
Answer: The information has not been released by the government at the moment. 


You can check more questions and answers, by clicking on Open Website button
